solution_line_template: You can find the distance of Jerome's run by multiplying the time he spends running by his speed: {jerome_speed} miles/hour * {jerome_time} hours = <<{jerome_speed}*{jerome_time}={trail_distance}>>{trail_distance} miles.

Then find Nero's speed by dividing the distance he runs by the time he spends running: {trail_distance} miles / {nero_time} hours = <<{trail_distance}/{nero_time}={nero_speed}>>{nero_speed} miles/hour.
